channel.title: Javascript debugging

item.title: Javascript debugging
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

document.wrong. Please use something more modern and less prone to doing confusing things. This function tries to write to the current document. If the document has already been processed, the document will be replaced with a blank one with your argument. If you don't want that, use the proper DOM methods instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Javascript debugging
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

var options = prompt("Good afternoon, Brian. Please type either calc or Paycheck to get started.");
	if (options === "calc") {

var price1 = prompt("Enter the first number.");
var price2 = prompt("Enter the second number.");
var tax = 1.07975;
document.write("The answer is " + (price1*price2*tax) );

	} else if(options === "Paycheck") {
	
var hours = prompt("How many hours did you put in this week?");
var wages = prompt("and how much do you make an hour, Brian?"
document.write("Brian, you will make" + (hours*wages) + "before taxes.");
	} else {
	
document.write("You did not make a valid choice. Please reload the page and try again.");

This was the problem and if you care to see the solution:

var options = prompt("Good afternoon, Brian. Please type either calc or Paycheck to get started.");
	if (options === "calc") {

var price1 = prompt("Enter the first number.");
var price2 = prompt("Enter the second number.");
var tax = 1.07975;
alert("The answer is " + (price1*price2*tax));

	} else if(options === "Paycheck") {
	
var hours = prompt("How many hours did you put in this week?");
var wages = prompt("and how much do you make an hour, Brian?");
alert("Brian, you will make" + (hours*wages) + "before taxes.");
	} else {	
alert("You did not make a valid choice. Please reload the page and try again.");
}

Read full topic
